Senior Software Engineer at The Nerdery
June 8, 2017, Dylan reported directly to Leah

After negative experiences with previous managers, Leah single-handedly restored my faith in management. She positions herself to be the go-to resource for anything that prevents you from doing your job. Leah is swift and effective at resolving issues, and extremely proactive if there may be problems looming on the horizon. Leah not only makes you want to become better, but removes all friction and makes it seem like there are no other options. It worked, Throughout the course of Leah managing my team, we became more tightly knit and greatly improved our skillset.Despite enormous swings in workload, Leah always made time for anybody that needed it. She knew when to empower people to solve their own problems, when to just listen, and when she needed to go ruin somebody’s day on your behalf.I completely trusted that Leah was an advocate for my team’s best interests.Leah is my new standard to which I will hold all future managers.

June 7, 2017, Richard reported directly to Leah

One of my mentors early in my career once told me "People join companies, but they quit managers." Reflecting on my experiences in the software development industry, I sincerely believe that to be true. I've reported to a bunch of shitty managers who somehow ended up in that position without a passion for performing that role or respect for their reports. And every time I eventually had enough and left that organization. I honestly have to exclaim that Leah is NOT that type of manager. She genuinely cares about our team and how we fit in with the overall Nerdery organization and culture. And, honestly, these traits are all I could ever ask for in a supervisor. Respect and unwavering support for our team while protecting us so we can effectively do our jobs is why Leah is the best leader I've ever been fortunate enough to work with.

I can confidently say that in my career, I have met few people who are as passionate about great management as Tom. He has been influential to our department in so many ways, he has helped define our engineering teams structure and assisted in creating a framework for our development management staff to use when aligning our teams towards our goals. He is seen as a leader amongst his peers and as one of them, I often seek Tom out for advice when faced with a tricky problem. Having never reported to Tom, but seeing how his direct reports respond to him and the results that he gets from the teams he has managed, I can say that Tom is an exceptional manager. He can successfully rally and align a team towards a goal, he can make the tough call when it needs to be made, and he creates an environment that high performing team members want to be a part of. Oh, and then he gets our of their way and let's them do awesome things :). I feel very lucky to be working with Tom, he constantly strives to be better and pushes those around him to be better too.

In an environment and industry where things are constantly changing, Kia has the unique ability to stay focused and work towards a plan, rather than constantly react. She also understands when it's necessary to pivot or make changes to that plan for the benefit of our organization and clients. As a boss, she inspires me to improve every day, while always (and I mean always) having my back. I can confidently attribute the positive changes to the Nerdery's Software Development Department over the past few years to Kia.
